title: How to Give Your Build a Bear a Bath

steps.headline: Take all the clothing and accessories off the bear.
steps.description: These things need to be washed separately, and you need to get to clean all of the bear anyway.

steps.headline: Fill a sink, large bowl, or basin up with lukewarm water.
steps.description: Make sure it's not too hot for the bear's fabric – if you make the water too hot it may shrink or harm the bear's fur.

steps.headline: Put a little soap in the sink.
steps.description: Make sure the soap is a mild soap such as dish soap.

steps.headline: Take a face cloth and lightly dip it in the soapy water, rub this over your build-a-bear scrubbing till clean.
Scrub the bear in stained areas using a soft toothbrush.
steps.description: Gently scrub the bear's fur until the stains or heavy dirt come loose.

steps.headline: Drain the water out.
steps.description: Make sure the soap goes with it.

steps.headline: Rinse the bear with the face cloth.
steps.description: Make sure there is no soap left.

steps.headline: Try to get as much water out of your bear as possible.
steps.description: Twist and squeeze as hard as you can. This is a very important step.

steps.headline: Rub your bear dry with a towel.
Put your bear in the dryer.
steps.description: Only use low heat. Don't forget the dryer sheet if you use them.

steps.headline: If the build a bear has a furry hair, brush it until it is successfully dry.
steps.description: Some build a bear has no fur, so just carefully put the clothes back. Your build a bear is now huggable and clean again.

Put a little soap in the sink. Make sure the soap is a mild soap such as dish soap. Take a face cloth and lightly dip it in the soapy water, rub this over your build-a-bear scrubbing till clean. Rinse the bear with the face cloth. Make sure there is no soap left. Try to get as much water out of your bear as possible. Twist and squeeze as hard as you can. This is a very important step. Rub your bear dry with a towel.  Put your bear in the dryer. Only use low heat. Don't forget the dryer sheet if you use them.
